patch_notes.html:
NEW CHALLENGES APPROACH! It’s time for patch 12.9, and with it the launch of our brand new Challenges system. Complete them to prove that you really are the best of the best!

Make sure to brace yourselves for more axes and rocks because the mid-scope updates for Olaf and Taliyah go live this patch! Other challenges we’ll be tackling in this edition of Patch Notes include zombies running into towers, capitalist chem-baron monopolies, foxes dashing around the Rift, a not-so-jolly mustachioed man, and cowboys rootin’, tootin’, and (by god?) shootin’ in my Ranked games.

Make sure to follow the Mid-Season Invitational in Busan where Group Stage will be kicking off on May 10! We’ll also be releasing the EDG skinline in celebration of their 2021 World Championship win!

Looking for more challenges? Well, hit the Convergence where Dragon Eggs are shaking things up right before Dragonlands. Read about it in the TFT patch notes here!
Lilu “Riru” Cabreros Jina "ahrisoo" Yoon Paul "RiotAether" Perscheid

Patch Highlights

High Noon Katarina, High Noon Leona, High Noon Mordekaiser, High Noon Talon, High Noon Varus, and Prestige High Noon Talon will be available May 12, 2022.

EDG Aphelios, EDG Graves, EDG Viego, EDG Yuumi, and EDG Zoe will also be available May 12, 2022.

Challenges

Challenges track your overall progress within League across a ton of categories. Build your legacy through over 300 unique Challenges that celebrate the champs you've mained, modes you've conquered, plays you've made, stuff you've collected, and more.

Show off the Challenges you’re most proud of with Titles and Token. You can see how you measure up in your region with regional leaderboards—now you can finally hit Challenger in something.

No matter how you play, there's a Challenge for you. Learn more about how Challenges work in our full rundown.

Champions

updated

Olaf

Mid-scope update, all abilities adjusted.

Despite Olaf’s popularity in Pro, he’s been one of the least mained champions in League for a while now. The flexibility of Ragnarok as an engage or escape and his fast clear speeds make him the ultimate example of a champ that walks the fine line between OP in Pro and “...meh” in all other levels of play.

With this mid-scope update, we’re aiming to shift some of his power away from his clear speed and into tools that will help players feel stronger and in more control of Olaf’s survivability as he rides the edge of disaster at low health. These changes should not only help better define Olaf’s identity as a Berserker, but also allow him to take a new place as a viable top laner.

Base Stats

AD Growth 3.5 ⇒ 4.7
AD at level 18 127.5 ⇒ 148
Health Growth 100 ⇒ 105
Mana Growth 42 ⇒ 50

Passive - Berserker Rage

Maximum Attack Speed Granted 99% ⇒ 40-100% (levels 1-18)
newFIGHT ON Berserker’s Rage now provides 10-30% life steal (levels 1-18), based on Olaf’s missing health
updatedMAD MATH Bonuses max out at 0% Health ⇒ 30% Health

Q - Undertow

Cooldown 7 seconds ⇒ 9 seconds
Damage 80/125/170/215/260 ⇒ 60/110/160/210/260
Minimum Range 300 ⇒ 425 units
Mana Cost 60 at all ranks ⇒ 40/45/50/55/60
updatedPRO AXE JUGGLER Picking up axes now fully refunds Q - Undertow's cooldown, but axes can only be thrown a maximum of once every 3 seconds. (Note: The 3 second limit scales with Ability Haste.)
updatedCOMING THROUGH Included a quality of life buff to Olaf’s Q - Undertow so that it now grants ghosting more consistently to jungle monsters who he hits or are near him when Q is cast

W - Tough It Out

updatedNAME CHANGE Vicious Strikes ⇒ Tough It Out
Cooldown 16 seconds at all ranks ⇒ 16/14.5/13/11.5/10 seconds
Attack Speed 50/60/70/80/90% ⇒ 40/50/60/70/80%
Ability Duration 6 seconds ⇒ 4 seconds
newJUST W now resets Olaf’s basic attack timer
newTOUGH On activation Olaf now gains a 10/45/80/115/150 (+25% missing health, capped at 30% of his current HP) shield for 2.5 seconds
removed IT No longer grants Life Steal
removed OUT No longer amplifies Olaf’s healing based on missing health

R - Ragnarok

Bonus Attack Damage 15/20/25 (+30% AD) ⇒ 10/20/30 (+25% AD)
Duration 6 seconds ⇒ 3 seconds
Passive Resists 20/30/40 ⇒ 10/25/40
removed I AM UNTETHERED R - Ragnarok's passive bonus resistances are no longer lost for the duration of the ability
newMY RAGE KNOWS NO BOUNDS Hitting a champion with a basic attack or E - Reckless Swing extends the duration of Ragnarok to 2.5 seconds. Olaf can refresh Ragnarok indefinitely.
updated

Taliyah

Mid-scope update, all abilities adjusted.

Get ready to rock and roam because the one and only Stoneweaver is ready to rumble (the ground). Taliyah has been struggling to find footing on the Rift, not only in mid, but in the jungle as well—not to mention the mechanical complexity and punishing nature of her kit.

For Taliyah’s update, we really wanted to focus on making her more fun (especially for players who’ve been playing her frequently), reviving her presence in mid, and increasing the amount of forgiveness in her kit. We’re hoping these changes shake things up and give her a clean slate to start anew!

Base Stats

Base Health 531 ⇒ 500
Base Health Regen 7 ⇒ 6.5
Health Regen Growth 0.7 ⇒ 0.65
Base Mana 425 ⇒ 470
Base Mana Regen 9.34 ⇒ 8
Mana Regen Growth 0.85 ⇒ 0.8
Base Armor 20 ⇒ 18
Move Speed 335 ⇒ 330

Passive - Rock Surfing

Out of Combat Bonus Move Speed 20-45% (levels 1-18) ⇒ 10/20/35/55% (levels 1/9/12/15)
Passive Fall Off Time when not near Terrain 1 second ⇒ 2.5 seconds

Q - Threaded Volley

Mana Cost 50/60/70/80/90 ⇒ 60/65/70/75/80
Cooldown 7/6/5/4/3 seconds ⇒ 6.5/5.5/4.5/3.5/2.5 seconds
1-Rock Damage 70/95/120/145/170 (+45% AP) ⇒ 38/61/84/107/130 (+50% AP)
Damage Reduction from Subsequent Stone Shards 50% ⇒ 60%
5-Rock Damage 210/285/360/435/510 (+135% AP) ⇒ 98.8/158.6/218.4/278.2/338 (+130% AP)
Damage Reduction from Subsequent Stone Shards Against Monsters 25% ⇒ 60%
newSUPER EFFECTIVE Each Stone Shard now deals an additional 30 (+10% AP) damage against monsters
newSCATTERED STONES Stone Shards now deal damage in a 175 radius area of effect (approximately 1.6 Teemos)
newROCK SOLID Q - Threaded Volley will now continue to cast while Taliyah is in Stasis
newNOT JUST A ROCK Casting Q - Threaded Volley on Worked Ground now consumes the Worked Ground to fire a single Boulder that deals double damage [76/122/168/214/260 (+100% AP)] and slows all targets hit in a 225 AoE radius by 30/35/40/45/50% for 2 seconds
Mana Cost on Worked Ground 1 ⇒ 20
Minimum Cooldown on Worked Ground 1 second ⇒ 0.75 seconds
Worked Ground Duration 25 seconds ⇒ 30 seconds
Worked Ground Radius 300 ⇒ 400
updatedLEVEL GROUNDS The size of Worked Ground on Howling Abyss now matches Summoner’s Rift
newSKIPPING STONES Q - Threaded Volley casts on Worked Ground now has new VFX, SFX, animation, and icon!

W - Seismic Shove

Mana Cost 70/80/90/100/110 ⇒ 40/30/20/10/0
Cooldown 16/15/14/13/12 seconds ⇒ 14/12.5/11/9.5/8 seconds
Knock Up Radius 200 ⇒ 225
Time Delay before Knock Up 0.8 seconds ⇒ 0.75 seconds
removedSOFT LIKE SAND W - Seismic Shove no longer deals damage

E - Unraveled Earth

Cooldown 16/14/12/10/8 seconds ⇒ 16/15/14/13/12 seconds
Damage on Initial Cast 50/75/100/125/150 (+40% AP) ⇒ 60/105/150/195/240 (+60% AP)
Slow Strength 20% (+4% AP) ⇒ 20/22/24/26/28% (AP ratio removed)
Boulder Detonation Damage 50/60/70/80/90 (+30% AP) ⇒ 25/45/65/85/105 (+30% AP)
Damage Reduction per Subsequent Boulder Hit 15% ⇒ 25%
Maximum Boulder Detonation Damage 155/186/217/248/279 (+93% AP) ⇒ 62.5/112.5/162.5/212.5/262.5 (+75% AP)
Delay Between Casting and Spawning First Row of Boulders 0.1 seconds ⇒ 0 seconds
Delay Between Spawning Rows of Boulders after the First Row 0.1 seconds ⇒ 0.17 seconds
updatedTECTONIC SHIFTS E - Unraveled Earth now spawns 6 rows of boulders extending outwards from Taliyah with 4 boulders per row (previously spawned 4 rows of boulders with 6 boulders per row)
newA ROCK AND A HARD PLACE Boulders now stun enemies that dash through them for the duration of the dash + 0.6/0.7/0.8/0.9/1 seconds. (Note: the max stun duration is 2 seconds and monsters are always stunned for the max duration).
removedIT’S JUST A BOULDER E - Unraveled Earth no longer detonates to deal additional damage after 4 seconds

R - Weaver’s Wall

Range 3000/4500/6000 ⇒ 2500/4500/6500
Dash Range when Jumping off Wall 400 ⇒ 700
Dash Speed when Jumping off Wall 1000 ⇒ 1200
updatedSKIPPING ROCKS Moving Taliyah while she is riding the Weaver’s Wall now causes Taliyah to dash to the location clicked, up to the maximum dash range instead of dropping her perpendicular to the wall.
updatedSURFS UP Dashing when jumping off of the wall is now more forgiving when trying to dash through terrain
newNOT SO FAST LITTLE SPARROW Damage from enemy champions or structures now prevents Taliyah from casting R - Weaver’s Wall for 3 seconds
removedTHE PIONEERS USED TO RIDE THESE FOR MILES Taking damage no longer knocks Taliyah off her wall

Bugfixes

  • Fixed a bug where Taliyah would sometimes lose her passive permanently if she had a spell shield active
  • Fixed a bug where Taliyah would sometimes not get reduced cooldown on her Q - Threaded Volley when cast on Worked Ground

Ahri

E cooldown increased. R cooldown increased at all ranks.

Ahri's been getting a lot of play time since her update. She's incredibly consistent at making picks and assassinating carries, all while remaining relatively safe and just out of reach. We're lowering the uptime on her CC and dashes to add more thrill to the chase.

E - Charm

Cooldown 12 seconds ⇒ 14 seconds

R - Spirit Rush

Cooldown 130/105/80 seconds ⇒ 140/115/90 seconds

Braum

Passive cooldown decreased late. E damage reduction increased.

Everyone’s favorite Poro Protector has been feeling a little left out in the cold recently. We’re hoping to bring a smile back to his glorious mustache (and his poros’ faces) by beefing up his protective power.

Passive - Concussive Blows

Per-Target Cooldown 8/7/6 seconds ⇒ 8/6/4 seconds

E - Unbreakable

Damage Reduction 30/32.5/35/37/40% ⇒ 35/40/45/50/55%

Hecarim

Q AD scaling increased. W cooldown decreased.

Hecarim is hecc'in weak after the last set of nerfs targeted at his tank build. We're helping him get his hooves back in the game (while being careful to avoid reintroducing his one-shot E build) by buffing his item scaling and increasing the horsepower behind his key survivability skill to more evenly distribute his power across his kit. These should help Hecarim find a more stable place in today’s meta without turning him into a pseudo-assassin race horse.

Q - Rampage

Physical Damage 60/90/120/150/180 (+85% bonus AD) ⇒ 60/90/120/150/180 (+90% bonus AD)

W - Spirit of Dread

Cooldown 18 seconds ⇒ 14 seconds

Master Yi

R bonus attack speed reduced.

The Wuju Bladesman has gotten a little too fast at killing his enemies, especially in late game. We're reducing his DPS scaling to slow him down and give his foes a chance to keep up.

R - Highlander

Bonus Attack Speed 25/45/65% ⇒ 25/35/45%

Nidalee

Base health reduced.

Nidalee's been catching prey left and right with her recently increased spell output, especially at higher levels of play. We're bringing down her early dueling power so she doesn't get such an easy Nida…lead.

Base Stats

Base Health 570 ⇒ 540

Pyke

Passive grey health conversion increased. Q mana cost increased, mana refund increased, now refunds mana upon hitting an enemy champion. R cooldown decreased, “Your Cut” opportunities reduced.

Pyke's been a little bone skewed toward mid ever since his changes long ago in Season 9, so we're reverting them to bring the Bloodwater Ripper back to bot lane. We're also adjusting some other parts of his kit to further tune him toward the unconventional support he is. Kills (and bags) secured.

Passive - Gift of the Drowned Ones

Damage Converted to Grey Health when near Two or more Enemies 40% (+0.5% per Lethality) ⇒ 45% (+0.5% per Lethality)

Q - Bone Skewer

newBONE APP THE TEETH Bone Skewer now refunds mana upon hitting an enemy champion
Mana Cost 50/55/60/65/70 ⇒ 74/78/82/86/90
Mana Refund:: 50% ⇒ 75%

R - Death From Below

Cooldown 120/100/80 seconds ⇒ 100/85/70 seconds
removedLIGHTER POCKETS Pyke no longer receives “Your Cut” gold upon successfully executing enemy champions with his R (last assisting ally will still receive “Your Cut”)
removedBOGO IS A NO GO Pyke no longer receives additional “Your Cut” gold when allies kill enemies within Death From Below’s execution area

Renata Glasc

Base armor decreased. Passive damage decreased.

Renata Glasc is on her way to monopolizing bot lane at all levels of play, and business is really starting to boom in Elite. She's been getting a bit too much value prop out of her passive, whereas her return on investment for damage-oriented support items has been relatively low. These small adjustments toward AP item scaling should help balance and diversify her build portfolio.

Base Stats

Base Armor 29 ⇒ 27

Passive - Leverage

Additional Magic Damage Against Marked Targets 1-3.5% (levels 1-13) (+1% per 100 AP) ⇒ 1-2% (levels 1-9) (+2% per 100 AP) (damage against unmarked targets unchanged)

Renekton

Health and AD growth increased. W base damage increased, cooldown increased early and decreased late. R base damage increased.

Renekton has largely disappeared from Pro after the fighter item changes in 12.3. We're looking to add some scaling back so he feels a bit better as the game progresses. We're also reducing the gap between his W and E second max builds since that choice leads to some serious win rate losses in Average play. You heard it here first, crocs are back in fashion.

Base Stats

Health Growth 92 ⇒ 97
AD Growth 3.75 ⇒ 4.15
AD at Level 18 132.75 ⇒ 139.55

W - Ruthless Predator

Cooldown 13/12/11/10/9 seconds ⇒ 16/14/12/10/8 seconds
Total Physical Damage 10/30/50/70/90 (+75% AD) ⇒ 10/40/70/100/130 (+75% AD)
Total Physical Damage when Empowered 15/45/75/105/135 (+75% AD) ⇒ 15/60/105/150/195 (+75% AD)

R - Dominus

Magic Damage per Second 40/80/120 (+10% AP) ⇒ 50/100/150 (+10% AP)

Rengar

W damage against monsters decreased.

Rengar’s changes in 12.7 helped this kitty adapt a little too well to the outdoors to the point where he’s now the top cat in the jungle. We're reverting a buff to his clear (and that buff only) to otherwise leave him as is.

W - Battle Roar

Damage to Monsters 85-150 (levels 1-18) ⇒ 65-130 (levels 1-18)

Bugfixes

  • Fixed a bug where Rengar’s empowered abilities and W - Battle Roar’s heal would sometimes play through the Fog of War

Shyvana

W damage tick rate decreased.

We’re introducing some small quality of life changes and a batch of bugfixes to help fan Shyvana’s flames.

W - Burnout

newThe area of effect zone from Shyvana’s E - Flame Breath now applies marks to enemies that enter the zone.

Bugfixes

  • Fixed a bug where Shyvana’s Q - Twin Bite would not attack player-created targets (like Teemo’s Mushrooms or Illaoi’s Tentacles) twice
  • Fixed a bug where Shyvana’s Q - Twin Bite’s second attack would not deal damage if the enemy was running away from her
  • Fixed a bug where Shyvana’s W - Burnout VFX were not correctly displaying when inside of Mordekaiser’s R - Death Realm

Sion

Undead Sion's Passive damage against structures reduced.

Sion's been a bit too glorious in death. Although "inting Sion" had a good run, we believe it isn't a sustainable direction for him or League in the long term. Taking down towers by split pushing should certainly be doable even while behind, but when the strat requires repeatedly dying, it’s not very fun for all parties involved. We're nerfing undead Sion's split pushing power in order to restore some balance to his circle of life.

Passive - Glory in Death

newNOT A WRECKING BALL Sion now does 40% reduced damage to structures while in his reanimated frenzy form (includes runes and items)

Thresh

Passive AP and Bonus Armor per Soul increased. W shield strength scaling with Souls increased.

What is the value of a soul? (Currently, not very much… ) Thresh has fallen off quite a bit, particularly in Average and Skilled play, so we're increasing his scaling power by making it more worthwhile to collect the essence of the dead. Gotta catch 'em all.

Passive - Damnation

Ability Power and Bonus Armor per Soul 0.75 ⇒ 1

W - Dark Passage

Shield Strength 60/90/120/150/180 (+1 per Soul) ⇒ 60/90/120/150/180 (+2 per Soul)

Varus

Passive attack speed gained on minion and champion kills increased. W magic damage on-hit increased.

Varus has been relatively weak since his Lethality nerfs last season. We're buffing his on-hit builds back up to make his vengeance viable again.

Passive - Living Vengeance

Bonus Attack Speed on Non-Champion Kills 10/15/20% (+15% bonus Attack Speed) ⇒ 10/15/20% (+20% bonus Attack Speed)
Bonus Attack Speed on Champion Kills 40% (+30% bonus Attack Speed) ⇒ 40% (+40% bonus Attack Speed)

W - Blighted Quiver

Bonus Magic Damage On-Hit 7/10.5/14/17.5/21 (+30% AP) ⇒ 7/12/17/22/27 (+30% AP)

Items

Hullbreaker

Hullbreaker is an important tool for empowering split pushing, but when rushed as a first item, its bounty-ful bonus resists can invalidate laning and lead to unpleasant experiences. We still think it's a valuable addition to the game since, unlike past split push items like Zz'Rot, Hullbreaker requires champions to stay in the lane they’re split pushing. So we're nerfing its early game potency.
Champion Bonus Resists While Hunting Alone (Melee) 20-60 (levels 1-18) ⇒ 10 (levels 1-11), then 20/35/43/51/59/67/75 (levels 12-18)
Champion Bonus Resists While Hunting Alone (Ranged) 10-30 (levels 1-18) ⇒ 5 (levels 1-11), then 10/17.5/21.5/25.5/29.5/33.5/37.5 (levels 12-18)
updatedSTURDIER HULLS Deal 20% bonus damage from all sources against structures ⇒ ONLY attacks deal 20% bonus damage against structures

MSI Clash

MSI 2022 is here, and so are the MSI-themed Clash tournaments! Team formation for the Clash MSI Cup started on May 9, and the tournament begins on May 14 and 15! Team formation for week 2 of the Cup will start on May 16 with the tournament days being May 21 and 22!

As part of MSI Clash, players who purchase a Premium Ticket during Clash are eligible for the following rewards: (NOTE: JP region is excluded from this reward due to legal restrictions.)

Players who place 1st through 5th in the tournament will receive a random legacy Conqueror Skin Permanent

Players who place 6th-8th will receive a legacy Conqueror Skin Shard

Client Update

We have removed the self-repair button from the League of Legends client settings menu as it was a redundant feature. Client self-repair can still be accessed through the Riot Games client settings menu.

Bugfixes & QoL Changes

  • Fixed a bug where Swain’s old ability descriptions were displaying in the Champion Details Page
  • Fixed a bug where Swain could reactivate his E - Nevermove to pull enemies closer to him even if they had cleansed the Root effect
  • Fixed a bug where Rengar could still deal damage with his Q - Savagery when blinded by Teemo’s Q - Blinding Dart
  • Fixed a bug where Chaos (Red) side inhibitors would display blue icons when selected
  • Fixed a bug where Kayle’s movement and attack VO lines were not playing correctly while Ascended
  • Fixed a bug where Elise’s W - Volatile Spiderling was ignoring Baron and not exploding
  • Fixed a bug where Nocturne’s R - Paranoia VO line would play louder than intended if players had visibility of more than 1 champion affected by nearsightedness
  • Fixed a bug where Black Belt Udyr’s Bear Stance was not displaying the correct visual textures
  • Fixed a bug where Irelia would only receive stacks of her Passive - Ionian Fervor for Champions hit when hitting Champions and minions/monsters simultaneously
  • Fixed a bug where Lillia was not receiving the correct among of healing from her Passive - Laden Bough
  • Fixed a bug where the sound effects for Ashe’s W - Volley would stop playing if it was leveled up to Rank 2 on-cast
  • Fixed a bug where Gangplank’s R- Cannon Barrage would cancel allies’ auto attacks if it was upgraded with Raise Morale
  • Fixed a bug where Ekko’s Q - Timewinder tooltip was displaying the incorrect AP ratio
  • Fixed a bug where the damage from Janna’s Q - Howling Gale was not correctly factoring in the ability’s base AP ratio
  • Fixed a bug where Wukong’s E - Nimbus Strike into Q - Crushing Blow combo would fail to stack Conqueror
  • Fixed a bug where Turrets would prioritize and target enemies damaged by Kog’Maw’s Passive - Icathian Surprise
  • Fixed a bug where Master Yi’s Q - Alpha Strike sound effects would sometimes be audible to the enemy team in the Fog of War
  • Fixed a bug where Shaco’s Passive - Backstab was sometimes audible to the enemy team from the Fog of War
  • Fixed a bug where Aphelios’ gun swapping and ability sound effects would sometimes be audible from the Fog of War
  • Fixed a bug where the sound of Scuttle’s shield breaking would play through the Fog of War

Upcoming Skins & Chromas

The following skins will be released in this patch:

High Noon Katarina

High Noon Leona

High Noon Mordekaiser

High Noon Varus & High Noon Talon

Prestige High Noon Talon

EDG Aphelios, EDG Graves, EDG Viego, EDG Yuumi, & EDG Zoe

The following chromas will be released this patch:

High Noon Katarina

High Noon Leona

High Noon Mordekaiser

High Noon Varus

High Noon Talon

EDG Aphelios

EDG Graves

EDG Viego

EDG Yuumi

EDG Zoe

messages.abilities-spells-and-items.title: Abilities, Spells & Items
messages.abilities.description: Most champions have a unique kit made up of five abilities: a [Passive](tooltip:passive-ability), three [Basics](tooltip:basic-abilities), and an [Ultimate](tooltip:ultimate-ability). These abilities are mapped to the Q, W, E, and R keys.

messages.about.title: About
messages.all.title: All
messages.assassins.description: Assassins are highly mobile melee combatants who can quickly take down opponents. Their low defenses mean they must execute their kills with precision or risk being shut down themselves.
messages.assassins.title: Assassins
messages.available-skins.title: Available Skins
messages.basic-abilities.description: Your champion’s basic abilities are mapped to the Q, W, and E keys and can be leveled up throughout the course of the game. They sometimes cost mana to cast or have a cooldown period.
messages.basic-abilities.title: Basic abilities

messages.champion-skins.title: Champion Skins
messages.champion.ahri.description: Ahri outfoxes her enemies with dashes and bursts of movement speed. Her entrancing magic draws foes in, leaving them overextended and vulnerable.
messages.champion.ahri.name: Ahri
messages.champion.ahri.title: The Nine-Tailed Fox
messages.champion.akali.name: Akali
messages.champion.akali.title: The Rogue Assassin
messages.champion.brand.description: Brand incinerates enemies with combustible combos. His scorches burn enemies over time and he ignites inferno-sized flares for deadly damage.
messages.champion.brand.name: Brand
messages.champion.brand.title: The Burning Vengeance
messages.champion.braum.name: Braum
messages.champion.braum.title: The Heart of The Freljord
messages.champion.chogath.name: Cho’Gath
messages.champion.chogath.title: The Terror of the Void
messages.champion.darius.description: Darius decimates his enemies with increasing brutality. He slashes through multiple foes at once, then mercilessly executes them one after another.
messages.champion.darius.name: Darius
messages.champion.darius.title: The Hand of Noxus
messages.champion.ekko.description: Ekko tampers with time to skirmish around foes. He can rewind to a previous location to escape, or hit reverse on the way out to re-engage with a bang.
messages.champion.ekko.name: Ekko
messages.champion.ekko.title: The Boy Who Shattered Time
messages.champion.garen.description: Garen strikes down scores of foes by spinning around with his huge sword. He dispenses justice by calling down an almighty blade to execute enemies.
messages.champion.garen.name: Garen
messages.champion.garen.title: The Might of Demacia
messages.champion.jinx.name: Jinx
messages.champion.jinx.title: The Loose Cannon
messages.champion.leona.name: Leona
messages.champion.leona.title: The Radiant Dawn
messages.champion.lux.description: Lux lights up foes from afar, binding targets in place to line up brilliant attacks. Her burst of spells ends with the blast from her giant laser beam.
messages.champion.lux.name: Lux
messages.champion.lux.title: The Lady of Luminosity
messages.champion.masteryi.description: Master Yi strikes swiftly and relentlessly. He warps into the middle of a fight to slash his target or to nimbly evade an enemy counterattack.
messages.champion.masteryi.name: Master Yi
messages.champion.masteryi.title: The Wuju Bladesman
messages.champion.missfortune.description: Miss Fortune sinks her enemies with attacks that hit like cannonballs. She can fire off a single shot or unload a barrage of bullets in a teamfight.
messages.champion.missfortune.name: Miss Fortune
messages.champion.missfortune.title: The Bounty Hunter
messages.champion.sona.description: Sona performs an enchanting symphony, changing melodies to enhance allies and control enemies. Her sweeping crescendo leaves the enemy team stunned.
messages.champion.sona.name: Sona
messages.champion.sona.title: Maven of the Strings
messages.champion.thresh.name: Thresh
messages.champion.thresh.title: The Chain Warden
messages.champion.tristana.description: Tristana’s explosive charges take down towers in record time. She rocket launches in and out of combat, resetting every time she explodes an enemy.
messages.champion.tristana.name: Tristana
messages.champion.tristana.title: The Yordle Gunner
messages.champion.warwick.name: Warwick
messages.champion.warwick.title: The Uncaged Wrath of Zaun
messages.champion.yasuo.name: Yasuo
messages.champion.yasuo.title: The Unforgiven
messages.champions.title: Champions
messages.cloud-drake.description: Cloud Drake grants the slayer’s team increased cooldown reduction for the rest of the game. When the map is dominated by the Cloud Drake, new movement zones appear in the jungle that boost your movement speed.
messages.cloud-drake.title: Cloud Drake
messages.day-1.title: Day 1
messages.day-2.title: Day 2
messages.day-3.title: Day 3
messages.day-4.title: Day 4

messages.earn-experience.title: Earn Experience
messages.earn-gold.title: Earn Gold
messages.elder-dragon.description: Elder Dragon spawns once three of the same Elemental Drake are slain. When Elder Dragon is slain, it grants the slayer’s team true damage burn over time and the ability to instantly kill opponents below a certain health level upon dealing damage.
messages.elder-dragon.title: Elder Dragon
messages.error-page.description: The page you were looking for was not found.
messages.esports-and-more.title: Esports and More
messages.facebook.title: Facebook
messages.featured-news.title: Featured
messages.fighters.description: Fighters are short-ranged combatants who excel at both dealing and surviving damage. They are weak against champions who excel at crowd control, fighting from a long range, and mobility.
messages.fighters.title: Fighters
messages.flash.description: Flash instantly blinks your champion a short distance when activated. This can help you dodge deadly attacks or close the gap when chasing a kill.
messages.flash.title: Flash
messages.fog-of-war.description: The Fog of War covers the entire map, limiting your team’s field of vision. Things like team turrets, minions, and wards are crucial to maintaining sight.
messages.fog-of-war.title: Fog of War
messages.fountain.description: The Fountain is where champions first spawn, respawn after dying, and appear after recalling to base. This area also protects the home team by dealing massive damage to any opponents who approach.
messages.fountain.title: Fountain
messages.gallery.title: Gallery
messages.game-mode.aram.description: Battle across an icy bridge as your team of random champions charge toward the enemy Nexus in this chaotically fun 5v5 game mode.
messages.game-mode.aram.headline: All Random, All Mid
messages.game-mode.aram.name: ARAM
messages.game-mode.summoners-rift.description: Clear your lane, dive into epic 5v5 team fights, and destroy the enemy nexus before they destroy yours.
messages.game-mode.summoners-rift.headline: The most popular game mode
messages.game-mode.summoners-rift.name: Summoner’s Rift
messages.game-mode.team-fight-tactics.description: Assemble a squad of champions that battle on your behalf. Outlast all seven of your opponents and become the last person standing.
messages.game-mode.team-fight-tactics.headline: A free-for-all war for supremacy
messages.game-mode.team-fight-tactics.name: Teamfight Tactics
messages.game-modes.title: Game Modes
messages.goal.title: Goal
messages.highlights.title: Highlights
messages.how-to-play.title: How To Play
messages.ignite.description: Ignite deals true damage over time to enemy champions.
messages.ignite.title: Ignite
messages.infernal-drake.description: Infernal Drake grants the slayer’s team increased attack damage or ability power and increased armor or magic penetration for the rest of the game. When the map is dominated by the Infernal Drake, new pathways appear in the jungle.
messages.infernal-drake.title: Infernal Drake
messages.instagram.title: Instagram
messages.items.description: Items enhance your champion’s performance, like granting faster movement, improved damage, and reduced ability cooldowns. Unlike [Trinkets](tooltip:trinkets), they require gold to purchase.
messages.items.title: Items
messages.lane-positions.title: Lane Positions
messages.latest-news.title: Latest News
messages.league-of-legends.title: League of Legends
messages.level-1.title: Level 1
messages.level-10.title: Level 10
messages.level-2.title: Level 2
messages.level-3.title: Level 3
messages.level-4.title: Level 4

messages.level-6.title: Level 6
messages.level-7.title: Level 7
messages.level-8.title: Level 8
messages.level-9.title: Level 9
messages.linkedin.title: LinkedIn
messages.mages.description: Mages are typically long-range combatants who excel at crowd control, area of effect damage, and burst damage. They are vulnerable to highly mobile champions and those who can lock them down.
messages.mages.title: Mages
messages.marksmen.description: Marksmen are ranged combatants, relying on their attack speed to deal massive damage as they scale in game. They are vulnerable to burst damage and tend to be weaker in early game.
messages.marksmen.title: Marksmen
messages.minions.description: Minions are battling units that advance along a lane, automatically attacking any enemy unit or structure in their path. They can be melee, caster, or siege types.
messages.minions.title: Minions
messages.most-played.title: Most Played
messages.most-popular.title: Most Popular
messages.mountain-drake.description: Mountain Drake grants the slayer’s team additional damage to Baron, Drakes, Turrets, and Inhibitors for the rest of the game. When the map is dominated by the Mountain Drake, new walls appear in the jungle.
messages.mountain-drake.title: Mountain Drake
messages.neutral-monsters.title: Neutral Monsters
messages.ocean-drake.description: Ocean Drake grants the slayer’s team increased health and mana regeneration for the rest of the game. When the map is dominated by the Ocean Drake, new healing plants and enlarged brush for stealthing and stalking appear in the jungle.
messages.ocean-drake.title: Ocean Drake
messages.overview.title: Overview
messages.passive-ability.description: Your champion’s passive ability grants unique bonuses and sometimes requires a condition to be met. Unlike other abilities, it is available at the start of the game and can’t be leveled up.
messages.passive-ability.title: Passive ability
messages.playback.playback-progress.title: Playback Progress
messages.playback.time-remaining-with-time.title: Time remaining: %time%
messages.player-resources-guide.title: Player Resources Guide
messages.powering-up.title: Powering Up
messages.puzzle.stage3.letter:
To the Sentinels—
In the event of my death, I appoint Akshan as my successor, to inherit my weapon and keep Shurima protected from the forces of undeath.
May you one day find us,
Shadya
messages.puzzle.title: Sentinels of Light

messages.section.champion-explorer.heading:
Meet Some of
the Champs
messages.section.champion-list.description: With more than 140 champions, you’ll find the perfect match for your playstyle. Master one, or master them all.
messages.section.champion-list.title:
Choose Your
Champion
messages.section.champion-roles.description: Whether you like to dive straight into the fray, support your teammates, or something in between, there’s a spot for you on the Rift.
messages.section.champion-roles.title:
Choose Your
Champion
messages.section.champion-style.description: Make it personal by changing up the look of your favorite champions with skins.
messages.section.champion-style.title:
Slay With
Style
messages.section.download-app.description: Download the League app to stay connected to friends and the latest game and esports news.
messages.section.download-app.title: Take League With You
messages.section.game-modes.title:
Multiple Ways to
Play
messages.section.how-to-play.about.description: League of Legends is a team-based strategy game where two teams of five powerful champions face off to destroy the other’s base. Choose from over 140 champions to make epic plays, secure kills, and take down towers as you battle your way to victory.
messages.section.how-to-play.about.title: What is League of Legends?
messages.section.how-to-play.description: There’s a lot to learn about League, so we’ll start with the essentials. Explore the guide below to get the rundown on the most popular game mode.
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.neutrals.desc: In between the lanes is the jungle, where neutral monsters and jungle plants reside. The two most important monsters are Baron Nashor and the Drakes. Killing these units grants unique buffs for your team and can also turn the tide of the game.
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.neutrals.title: Take on The Jungle
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.neutrals.topic: Baron Nashor is the most powerful monster in the jungle. Killing Baron grants the slayer’s team bonus attack damage, ability power, empowered recall, and greatly increases the power of nearby minions.
Drakes, or dragons, are powerful monsters that grant unique bonuses depending on the element of the drake your team slays. There are five Elemental Drakes and one Elder Dragon.

Drakes, or Dragons, are powerful monsters that grant unique bonuses and even alter the terrain of the map depending on the element of the drake your team slays. There are five Elemental Drakes ([Infernal](tooltip:infernal-drake), [Cloud](tooltip:cloud-drake), [Mountain](tooltip:mountain-drake), [Ocean](tooltip:ocean-drake), and [Hextech](tooltip:hextech-drake)) and one [Elder Dragon](tooltip:elder-dragon).
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.objectives.des: The Nexus is the heart of both teams’ bases. Destroy the enemy’s Nexus first to win the game.
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.objectives.top: Located in the enemy team’s base, the enemy Nexus is just like yours. Destroying the enemy Nexus wins your team the game.
Your Nexus is where [minions](tooltip:minions) spawn. Behind your Nexus is the [Fountain](tooltip:fountain), where you can quickly replenish health and mana and access the [Shop](tooltip:shop).
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.positions.desc: There are five positions that make up the recommended team comp for the game. Each lane lends itself to certain kinds of champions and roles—try them all or lock in to the lane that calls you.
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.positions.topi: Bot lane champions are the dynamite of the team. As precious cargo, they need to be protected early on before amassing enough gold and experience to carry the team to victory.
Junglers live for the hunt. Stalking between lanes with stealth and skill, they keep a close eye on the most important neutral monsters and pounce the moment an opponent lets their guard down.
Mid laners are your high burst damage champions who can do it all—solo and as a team. For them, combat is a dangerous dance where they’re always looking for an opportunity to outplay their opponent.
Support champions are team guardians. They help keep teammates alive and primarily focus on setting up kills, protecting their teammate in bot lane until they become stronger.
Champions in top lane are the tough solo fighters of the team. It’s their job to protect their lane and focus on the enemy team’s most powerful members.
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.targets.desc: Your team needs to clear at least one lane to get to the enemy Nexus. Blocking your path are defense structures called turrets and inhibitors. Each lane has three turrets and one inhibitor, and each Nexus is guarded by two turrets.
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.targets.title: Clear The Path
messages.section.how-to-play.guide.targets.topic-: Each Inhibitor is protected by a Turret. When destroyed, [super minions](tooltip:super-minions) will spawn in that lane for several minutes. Afterward, the Inhibitor will respawn and Super Minions will stop spawning.

Turrets deal damage to enemy minions and champions, and provide limited vision from the [Fog of War](tooltip:fog-of-war) for their team. Attack these structures with minions ahead of you to avoid damage and charge ahead.
messages.section.how-to-play.hud.description: Champions have five core abilities, two special spells, and up to seven items at a time. Figuring out the optimal ability order, summoner spells, and item build for your champion will help you succeed as a team.
messages.section.how-to-play.hud.title: Unlock Your Abilities
messages.section.how-to-play.level.description: Champions get stronger by earning experience to level up and gold to buy more powerful items as the game progresses. Staying on top of these two factors is crucial to overpowering the enemy team and destroying their base.
messages.section.how-to-play.level.earn-experienc: When champions earn a certain amount of experience, they level up and can unlock or strengthen abilities and raise their base stats. Gain experience by killing enemy units and champions, assisting in a kill, and destroying defense structures.
messages.section.how-to-play.level.earn-gold.desc: Gold is the in-game currency to buy items for your champion. Earn gold by killing enemy units and champions, assisting in a kill, destroying defense structures, and equipping gold income items.
messages.section.how-to-play.level.title: Power Up Your Champ
messages.section.how-to-play.reward.description: You’ve got the basics down. Now it’s time to take it day by day—and level by level. Earn rewards when you log in daily (doesn’t have to be consecutive) and when you level up your account.
messages.section.how-to-play.reward.heading:
Start Playing
Earn Rewards
messages.section.how-to-play.title:
Welcome to The Rift
Learn The Basics
messages.section.player-guide.description: New to League? Get a rundown on the basics for the most popular game mode.
messages.section.player-guide.title:
Start Your
Legend
messages.see-other-social-channels.action: Check out our other social channels
messages.share-this-article.title: Share this article
messages.share.title: Share
messages.shop.description: The Shop is where you can buy and sell items with gold you’ve earned. It can only be accessed while you are at the Fountain.
messages.shop.title: Shop
messages.site.nexus.title: Nexus
messages.site.nexus.view-all-news.title: View All Nexus News
messages.skills-and-abilities.title: Skills & Abilities
messages.smite.description: Smite deals instantaneous true damage to monsters and is considered an essential spell for junglers to equip.
messages.smite.title: Smite
messages.social-network.line.title: Line
messages.starter-champions.title: Starter Champions
messages.structures.title: Structures
messages.suggested-lane.title: Suggested Lane
messages.summoner-spells.description: Summoner spells are abilities with unique effects that champions can use. They are mapped to the D and F keys. There are many spells, but a few commonly used ones are [Flash](tooltip:flash), [Teleport](tooltip:teleport), [Smite](tooltip:smite), and [Ignite](tooltip:ignite).
messages.summoner-spells.title: Summoner Spells
messages.super-minions.description: Super minions are more powerful minions with melee range. They can more easily take down enemy minion waves and defense structures.
messages.super-minions.title: Super minions
messages.teleport.description: Teleport can transport your champion to a friendly turret, minion, or ward anywhere on the map after a short delay.
messages.teleport.title: Teleport
messages.trinkets.description: Trinkets are unique items that can be purchased from the Shop for free. They assist in granting vision on the map or sweeping for enemy wards.
messages.trinkets.title: Trinkets
messages.twitch.title: Twitch
messages.twitter.title: Twitter
messages.ultimate-ability.description: Your champion’s ultimate ability is mapped to the R key and is available once you reach level 6. Ultimates are considered the most powerful and game-changing abilities.
messages.ultimate-ability.title: Ultimate ability
messages.view-image-x-of-y.action.icu: View image {x, plural, other {#}} of {y, plural, other {#}}
messages.vk.title: VK
messages.youtube.title: YouTube
